alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:43AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Atlantic, Ocean and southeastern Burlington Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 843 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Presidential Lakes Estates to near Chatsworth to Batsto. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Barnegat, Beachwood, Point Pleasant Beach, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Presidential Lakes Estates, Seaside Heights, Lakehurst, Surf City, Mantoloking, Presidential Lakes, Brick Township, Whiting, Brookville, Bass River State Forest, Batsto, Pine Ridge At Crestwood, New Gretna and Beach Haven West. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 51 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington
